function.summary: Sets are formed from the items in each sequence, removing duplicates in the process of forming sets. Returns true if for every item in the left sequence's set there is a c-equal item in the right sequence's set, and the sets have the same count of members. (Because c-equal is defined by XBRL only for items, operation is restricted to nodes that are items.)

input.name: left
input.xhtml:p: The first item or sequence of items.

input.name: right
input.xhtml:p: The second item or sequence of items.

output.xhtml:p: Sets are formed from the items in each sequence, removing duplicates in the process of forming sets. Returns true if for every item in the left sequence's set there is a c-equal item in the right sequence's set, and the sets have the same count of members.

error.xhtml:p: A dynamic error must be raised if any input element is not derived from xbrli:item.

reg:revision.xhtml:p: Clarified that sets are formed from the sequences, removing duplicates in the process of forming sets, and that operation is on the members of the (deduplicated) sets.
